decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the opponent through a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and card advantage. It utilizes cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Mental Misstep to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage through Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recasting key cards from the graveyard. The deck aims to outlast the opponent while gradually building up its own resources to secure victory.

This deck focuses on using control elements to slow down the opponent's game plan while assembling powerful combo pieces like Gifts Ungiven and Underworld Breach to generate advantage and close out the game. It utilizes efficient mana rocks and card draw spells to dig for key pieces, and disruptive counterspells to protect its game plan. The deck also employs Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent with careful resource management and precise decision-making.

This Esper Control deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements such as counterspells, creature removal, and card advantage to dominate the game. It also utilizes the companion Lurrus of the Dream-Den for additional value. With a mix of disruptive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog, along with powerful spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares, the deck aims to control the opponent's board and hand while building up incremental advantage. The inclusion of powerful artifacts and planeswalkers like Black Lotus and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade adds additional versatility and threats to the deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing Oath of Druids to cheat powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier into play quickly. The strategy involves controlling the game through counterspells like Force of Will and disruption cards like Show and Tell, while also benefiting from card draw and manipulation with cards like Ancestral Recall and Demonic Tutor. The deck also includes other powerful spells like Time Walk and Oko, Thief of Crowns to further control the board and outmaneuver the opponent. Overall, the deck aims to win by overwhelming the opponent with powerful creatures and game-changing spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on card advantage, disruption, and tempo plays to outlast and outmaneuver opponents. Utilizing cards like Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Force of Negation, along with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Psychic Frog, it aims to control the board and disrupt opponents' game plans. With the addition of powerful spells like Ancestral Recall, Demonic Tutor, and Time Walk, it can also generate card advantage or extra turns to pull ahead. The mana base is streamlined with strong lands like Polluted Delta and Underground Sea to support its strategy.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's strategy through counterspells, removal spells, and resource denial while generating card advantage with powerful draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Dig Through Time. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value by recasting cheap creatures and artifacts from the graveyard. The mana base is designed to support a variety of spells with a mix of dual lands and fetch lands. Overall, the deck aims to control the game's tempo and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This deck focuses on using Oath of Druids to cheat out powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier early in the game. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to control the game and protect its key cards. Show and Tell is another key card that can help put big threats into play. The deck also includes tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to search for important cards, along with card draw and manipulation spells to help find the necessary pieces to win the game.

The deck focuses on generating mana quickly with powerful artifacts like Black Lotus and Moxen, while using cards like Thundertrap Trainer and Paradoxical Outcome to draw cards and build up to a game-winning combo. It includes control elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo pieces, along with disruptive spells like Flusterstorm. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows the deck to recur key pieces from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to overwhelm the opponent.
